comments.body: Getting the source like this is quite unusual and may lead  problems down the road. But I am sure you know what you ware doing so I am fine merging this as-is. Just make a note to why you are doing this, it can be done in the feedstock later, so we keep track of this.

The issue here is that this is a single conda package for a multi-repo project, so there is no single source. I tried making the 'main' source the dolfin repo, but since it contains LFS files, conda-build can't clone repos with LFS files right now (https://github.com/conda/conda-build/issues/1462).

I asked @jakirkham about multiple sources, and he said that running git in build.sh was ~the only option for now while we wait for conda-build to support multiple sources (https://github.com/conda/conda-build/issues/1466).
That is why I asked for a comment there. So we don't have to keep asking the same question over-and-over :smile:
Good call, I'll add a note. I did just figure out a way to make the 'main' package (dolfin) the source in the meta.yaml, so it will at least be a little less weird.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +17,21 @@pkg=dolfin
echo "installing ${pkg}-${PKG_VERSION}"
git clone -q --depth 1 -b ${pkg}-${PKG_VERSION} https://bitbucket.org/fenics-project/${pkg}.git
pushd $pkg
# apply patches

@@ -1,1 +22,26 @@git apply "${RECIPE_DIR}/swig-py3.patch"
if [[ "$(uname)" == "Darwin" ]]; then
    git apply "${RECIPE_DIR}/clang6-explicit-in-copy.patch"
fi
